thread.title: 'Freddy Krueger' creep scaring British moms and babies
thread.title_full: 'Freddy Krueger' creep scaring British moms and babies - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: 'Freddy Krueger' creep scaring British moms and babies
text:
Florescu Viorel for Daily News The man in the 'Freddy Krueger' mask has been scaring British moms and babies by creeping up on them. A creep in a ‘Freddy Krueger’ mask has been scaring British moms and babies by sneaking up on them.
The cruel prankster has terrified parents and toddlers by leaping out at them unprovoked in the sleepy town of Eastleigh in Hampshire.
Nicole Greatrex, 35, and her one-year-old son Ronnie were spooked by the ‘Nightmare On Elm Street’ weirdo earlier this week.
"It was a bit weird, especially being several days before Halloween,” she told Mirror Online .
"I was quiet startled and I carried on walking and he seemed to be following me and behaving very strangely.
"It seemed he was waiting just out of view to jump out and then he was wandering in the middle of the road and friends had to pull him away."
Police attended the scene, although it remains unknown if the person was apprehended or spoken to.
Another woman added: "It might be intended as a joke but you can't do that to people you don't know. It was strange and a bit creepy."
British police have warned revelers preparing to celebrate Halloween to be mindful as the holiday approaches of scaring others with their outfits.
Chief Inspector Dave Pate, from Tunbridge Wells, said: "Most reports of people wearing masks can be explained as part of the run up to Halloween and Bonfire night.
"Whilst it’s not unusual for people to be wearing fancy dress, including masks, I would warn everyone to celebrate responsibly and not do anything which may cause alarm, distress of fear to others."
lhanna@nydailynews.com
